Reviews.Title: “The best location in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: loveworldtravel599
Reviews.Content: The BCN Design is a great hotel for a perfect trip! The location is very convenient and within walking distance to most main attractions. The hotel ammenities and friendly staff made our stay a great one. The staff is very knowledgeable and recommended great places to eat and things to do nearby. Close to shopping and great eateries, I definetely recommend this hotel for your next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Mine K
Reviews.Content: very good with all aspects especially Philippe in reception who is very helpful and friendly,helpful as a tourist guide i would stay in this hotel once again if I go to Barcelona once again

Reviews.Title: “Designed for people with passion”
Reviews.Author: man727
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my 6 nights stay at Eurostars BCN Design Hotel. My room has a bathtub in the middle of the room, king size bed and view of green interior courtyard. It is a beautiful hotel located on a vibrant street Passeig de Gracia. Many reviewers didn't like the design of the room, but I think you'd love it if you stayed there with your loved ones..... I highly recommend this hotel to those who love new ideas in everyday's life.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, interesting room, lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lashkins
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago when I went for the Mobile World Congress. This was a last minute booking. Although, I has my reservations initially, I quickly found out that the best feature of the hotel is its location. Very close the the metro, La Ramlas, Placa Catalunya, a Gaudi house, not too far from the old town, etc. Lovely restaurants around, good areas to explore. The room was quite nice (modern and simple), the bathroom has no place to put your soap or toiletries, decent room service and friendly front desk staff. My room had an ante-room that faced the back street. Clean and cosy. The breakfast was not good at all (watery scrambled eggs and dripping bacon). The coffee shop staff was efficient and very helpful. I would go there again but would try and negotiate the price a little bit. Oh yeah...not many TV channels that you can watch. Was stuck with a Spanish game show until I discovered that the wifi was pretty good in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen_mor
Reviews.Content: ..I never felt complied to write a review before, however, I was very impressed with the hotel, location and overall service from Phillipe on reception. I was originally booked into a 4 star hotel in Barcelona and was disappointed with the hotel, so after searching laterooms - I found the Eurostars BCN Design Hotel. I called and Phillipe was helpful with a sense of humour, who held onto the room until my arrival and not only provided a room (at the agreed rate) but also upgraded us to a fantastic room overlooking Passeig de Gracia, complete with bathtub in the room.. Just wonderful.. The hotel is in a great location, with jacuzzi and sun-terrace with the added bonus of the terrace on the 1st floor which is relaxing and ideal outdoor space. Never got the opportunity to thank him personally - so felt the hotel and service deserved a review..

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only positive”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaSunshine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, the rooms were clean very small and quite impractical, on the first night we stayed in a room which was adjacent to the road we found it to be very noisy, the room had a bath in the centre of teroom which looked very glam, but after bathing it wouldn't drain the water away and the room had a musty dampness to it, we requested to move as we had come away for a rest and needed to sleep comfortably, the receptionist was quite put out by our request and made sure we were aware of it!. She told us to have our cases packed the next morning an come back in the afternoon at 3pm to make the move, which we did, when we arrived at reception she looked at us with a very puzzled expression and said she assumed we never wanted to move because we had put the clean room sign on the door (our cases were inside ready packed and ready to be moved!!) again she treated us like we were a pain and changed her tone whilst speaking in Spanish. We were eventually moved to a quiet room, and it must have been the worst in the hotel, but I did not hae the energy to complain. Breakfast was disorganised they never seemed to have enough plates and glasses available and you would expect the staff to greet you and ask if you want tea or coffee, they were slow and everything seemed like to much trouble I expected to much I assumed it was 5 star!, The city is beautiful with so much to see still enjoyed the city break wont stay here again. No English tv.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel perfect for City Break”
Reviews.Author: Gissings
Reviews.Content: I stayed here January 2012 whilst on a girlie holiday. I stayed for 2 nights and I was blown away by the decor. The service was perfect, we had cava on arrival, we was advised on the best places to go, tours to attend. Food was great too. So happy I'm planning to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Alright place”
Reviews.Author: JLM235
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when attending a wedding in Barcelona over the summer. It was a bit expensive for the value but an OK place. The location is the best part. The rooms are clean and comfortable but a bit too eclectic (no bathroom doors, counter-space or outlets and no closets). Was fine for a long weekend but probably will find something a little better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with a spanish twist”
Reviews.Author: MARKUS A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in BCN Design a few days with my collegues and some clients. The hotel is "hidden" in the very middle of Barcelona, with reception one floor up from street level. The entrance in convenient once you have registered, since the lift takes you straight to your floor level. The lobby is stylish and compact. There is no separate breakfast room; a part of the lobby is used for serving breakfast in the morning. Corridoors are simple, but when you open the room door, you get a surprise: extremely modern room where eveything is open including showers and toilet (which are behind a glass door each). Overall special. Breakfast was good and eveything fresh. There was a small hickup though: the room in which I was staying was booked and paid for over almost a week. I left early after three days and another person from our group arrived that day and he was going to stay in the room I stayed in. I left my Mac charger into the room for him to use, but when he arrived a few hours after I had left, the charger was gone. And the room had not been cleaned, so somebody must have entered the room, and taken the charger. I contacted the hotel and told them that I feel they are responsible for the loss, which they did not agree to. In a hotel of this quality should not happen! So overall the experience in this hotel was good until it ended with a disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Tigas_Ko
Reviews.Content: This hotel, just like everyone here said, is close to most places/things you would come for in Barcelona. Shops, restaurant or tapas bar, the luxury stores and of course the famous and always filled with tourist and locals alike, the Las Ramblas. Close to transport too, the Passeig de Gracia Metro, the bus stops and also taxi stands. The hotel has no lobby, when you arrived by taxi, if the taxi driver didn't point you where the entrance is, you'll be lost! The entrance (very small and narrow), is between Nike and Ermenegildo Zegna stores and has no sign ligthing. It is across the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. It has a locked sliding door and you would be stumped how you would get in, lucky for us, a couple was coming out. You will then be presented to 2 lifts and would have to read which floor is the reception area. The reception is on the first floor which is just outside the lift, no fancy reception desk just plain reception which also houses the breakfast area on the right. The hotel has 5 floors with 70 rooms of accomodation. It has a rooftop Jacuzzi which can fit 8 to 10 people at the same time and the fitness centre which is also small is beside the Jacuzzi. It has no swimming pool but there is an outdoor sitting area on the first floor on the left of the reception, which if I would design it is make this the reception lobby because nobody sits there anyway. The hotel comes with a free wifi-G and not the N type which is adequate. Our room, no 405, is average in size, Be careful after you enter the room, the floor has a step down and if you were in a tired mood, you'll miss it and hurt yourself. it has the street view. The shower room and toilet are separated with wall and has doors. There is no bath tub that is why I called it shower room. But the sinks, just like the other reviewer said maybe cute but uncomfortable. It has a shelf right above it and since they're so small, you'd be lucky not to hit your head while washing your face and also wet the floor. The toiletries are mninmal, it has soap, bath gel, very small box of tissue, shower cap, no shampoo, no conditioner and no lotion, only came with 1 toothbrush and 1 comb. You also don't get free bottled water. The room has no couch with only 1 chair. The desk don't have drawers, the wardrobe cabinet don't have drawers too, you'll have to make do of putting all your undies and t-shirts together beside the safe inside the cabinet. There are plenty of space to put in drawers inside the wardrobe cabinet but I guess, the designer don't want you to stay more than 1 or 2 days! There are also no hooks to hang your clothes and this hotel is not green because it does not encourage you to recycle your towel for second use because there is nowhere you can hang your used towel to dry. Not a lot of thought for the comfort of the customers was put it here. No idea who this room design is targetted for. The bed is comfortable and one good in the room is that there are plenty of powerpoint outlets. The breakfast is good with not a lot of choices. Salad, fruits, different small muffins, smoked salmon and beef, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs but no fried eggs and is almost the same everyday. The staffs are friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but would not choose again; "Cool" ambiance but hardly practical”
Reviews.Author: JSS949
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed 4 nights at this hotel, but will not choose it again. I'm a very seasoned traveler; I love the niceties but don't have to have them. But I payed $190-$308/night (almost $900 total for my 4 nights) and expected more for the money. THE PRO's first: - Terrific location, lovely upscale neighborhood, a block from Casa Batlio, a couple blocks from Le Pedrera. Three short blocks north of Placa de Catalunya, and walking distance to the Gothic Quarter, La Boqueria market, La Rambla, Palau de la Musica...Loved the location and neighborhood - Phillipe, at the front desk, was most helpful. He had all the answers to our questions, was happy to help us with directions and daily walking agendas, spoke perfect English and had a good sense of humor - The decor of the main (1st) floor was very cool, very "mod", very red - Our room had a nice little balcony overlooking the street, and very good windows, so no street noise when they were closed - The bed was comfortable - Jacuzzi deck on Floor 5 was nice The CONS: - The other front desk people were hardly helpful. When Phillipe was not around, they barely could give directions, advice, information - The SINKS in the room were ridiculous. There were two round sinks, each about 12" in diameter (photo below), with a faucet dropping down in the middle. You couldn't wash your face WITHOUT GETTING WATER ALL OVER THE FLOOR. And my husband had the most difficult time shaving. They were just so impractical to use. They give you a tiny bar of soap (1" square) but there was no where to put it except leave it tossed in the sink. And a very small shelf near the sink to place your toiletries etc, was very inconvenient - The lighting near the sink was poor. I appreciated the makeup mirror but there was no light shining on it, so it was really useless - Shower was OK, however they gave you ONLY a tube of shower gel. NO BATH SOAP, NO SHAMPOO OR CONDITIONER, NO LOTION. I can't recall EVER staying in a $200/night hotel without those simple amenities. - They were really stingy with towels. For the two of us, they gave us 2 bath towels and 1 hand towel daily (and no washcloths). And they were rough and old, far from fluffy or luxurious. - The toilet was basically free standing (frosted glass walls) and tiny. If you're at all large, it's a stretch to get in and out of the bathroom stall, as the door swings in and nearly touches the toilet. And don't think of getting up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom without waking your spouse. Or feeling like you have much privacy at all to use the loo. - The free internet connection was not secure (no password needed) and the connection was so slow, it was so frustrating. The best connection I could get on my laptop in my room in my 4 days there was "48 MBPS, very slow". - The room lighting was bizarre. There were small tube lights next to the bed, and no matter what we tried, they remained on on one side, tho very dim, though the night - The room was hot. We set it on 19C (and it would set no lower), but we never heard the A/C kick on, no matter what it was set on - There was no clock in the room - There was a desk chair in the room, but that was the only chair The design was too cool to be practical. Maybe if I was just there for one night, it would have been palatable, but not for 4 nights. Clearly, the negatives outweighed the positives, so we'll be staying elsewhere when we return next to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, but dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ednago
Reviews.Content: I will start with the good things: The location is just great: 3-4 min. walk to Placa catalunya and then the Ramblas, 1 min. walk from Casa Batlio and about 15-20 min. of (lazy) walk to the Segrada Familia. It's close to everything. The service was ok, and breakfast was good. There's a free WiFi everywhere in the hotel, and that's a big plus. The bad thing is that the stylish design is not backed up with actual thinking about the costumer who's using the room. The hot water in the shower came about 10 min. after I caved in and started a cold (and terrible) shower. I was with a group on business trip, and some complained about the same thing but some didn't, so it depends on the room. Also, the TV didn't work, and the A/C I tried to chancge from cool to heat didn't manage to do so, so I frozed a little. I had no street view. Personally, I think that the idea of an open bathroom with no walls and door in the middle of the room is horrible, but I didn't have it in my room - be careful to ask about it when you order. The tiny sinks maby cute, but not comfortable, and have a shelf right above them so you have to stick your head in to wash your face... the lamps by the bed are tiny spots of light. So what's I'm saying is this: a) The design is not something to count on. b) It really depends on wich room you get, because they are all different. c) Is the location worth it? I havn't decided yet.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish! (thats all)”
Reviews.Author: mrtravelmore
Reviews.Content: The location was superb, right in passeig garcia, close to all the shops, restaurants, bars, and the plaza catalunya is just less than 5 minutes away. The room was stylish and the bed was good. Room looks nice and quirky (no bathroom walls) which I found quite impractical. Small sink, no vanity cabinet you end up putting your stuff in the bath tub. Having no bathroom door means that as soon as you got out from the shower cubicle you are greeted by the cold air from the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with a fantastic location and professional service”
Reviews.Author: HuntingtonSurfInn
Reviews.Content: We are in the hospitality industry, and did a little homework before coming to Barcelona. Had the usual choices of LeMeridien, several of the Eurostars, etc... and hopefully can provide you with a well balanced account as the reviews on TripA for this lodging border on two extremes. The location of this hotel is simply amazing. Located right on the Passeig de Gracia, you will be minutes away on foot from world class shopping like Louis Vuitton, Chanel, as well as markets and department stores (El Cortes Ingles) where you can buy daily amenities. La Rambla and the Plaça de Catalunya is only a safe and short walk away, but the hotel is located away from their hustle bustle, so noise and traffic is not a factor for your sleep. For the Gaudi buffs, Casa Battlo in on the next block, and Casa Mila is a few blocks away on the same street, saving you a lot of time in knocking out some of the most famous architectural high points of Barcelona. La Sagrada Familia is less than 10 euros away by taxi. The Metro station and the Hop on Hop off bus is a few seconds away on foot, as well. The hotel insulates itself from the street by having the lobby on a higher floor. The front desk manager Felipe is humorous, knowledgeable and professional. The bell captain was extremely courteous as well. Our room was well appointed with an LCD TV and a large round tub in room. The shower and toilet were in covered frosted glass stalls, so we did not think that privacy is an issue for a couple. If you are sharing a room with only a friend, you are indeed sleeping in the same room with the person, so we are not quite sure why there will be too much worries about toiletry functions behind a closed door. We read here about the lack of space for soaps, etc...but in reality, none of this was an issue. The room had a great deck, with chairs and table for a nice meal outdoors.The jacuzzi on the common deck was clean. Wifi worked. Overall, this is a boutique class hotel which can present a different experience than your usual Ritz Carlton or W or even LeMeridien. However, its pricing is significantly less than those hotels. Service is excellent, and the overall presentation is certain unique, yet functional enough for the seasoned travelers. Finally, its location is simply the best for someone looking for the sophisticated high end face of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: laura30_10
Reviews.Content: Good part= location, beds, chocolate cake at breakfast (!). Bad part= Other peoples' reviews on bathrooms, ie small sinks, no soap holder, bumping onto a shelf when brushing teeth, having to be really comfortable with other half to share this room, all are true. I couldnt agree more. Rooms are not welcoming, ours in particular was pretty small, although with street view. Half of the days the room was perfectly cleaned, the other half not as much. Definetely not luxurious. No luxurious bath products, no slippers, no water bottles in the fridge. Conclusion=This is NOT a 5 star hotel. I'd say it's a low 4 star one. Sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Style over function”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: A so called boutique hotel but many aspects are not functional. For example, the basin in the bathroom has no plug and nowhere dry to leave the soap. The first room I was shown was very very dark and the second very small, both smelt damp - I think because the showers don't drain properly. Wi fi didn't work and the business centre only has armchairs not desks! Breakfast good but zero atmosphere in the bar - I was on my own. Very poor wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joaq
Reviews.Content: As one of the front desk clerks told to a customer: "It isn't made to be functional, it is made to be good loking". Maybe these phrase resume what this Eurostars hotel, located in Passieg the Gracia superb location, is it's best description. It definitely is not a 5 stars hotel. Design of the rooms makes you feel kind of uncomfortable, since the bathroom is practically located within the room. Good looking, not functional. You can't wash your teeth without bumping your head with a silly shelf above the good loking washstands. Of course we didn't know about these bathroom issues, and will look for somewhere else to stay in other ocassion. We had a great terrace on our room and we could relax and have a glass of wine there after a working day. Could feel the Barcelona way of living. This was great. Bed was very comfortable and clean. To honour the good, all of the staff was ver friendly, professional and helpful in any way needed. Breakfast was always well appointed and served with courtesy. The superb locations is the best with a tranquil area to dine around and every other important attraction of the city very near from the hotel. For shoppers this surely is a very good place to stay. Do try the BCN if you have an open mind for modern design.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sol A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid August and the hotel was in a good location and the manager on reception was extremely helpful. He answered all out questions and gave us good advice and tips generally about Barcelona. The rooms were clean and contemporary and had a nice feel to them. All in all we would definitely going back and we would highly recommend staying at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “I missed the 5 star service, but superlocation”
Reviews.Author: Erwinwas
Reviews.Content: Everybody complaining about the bath in the room should stay somewhere else. The design and rooms are very nice. The room was not 100% in order, and we had a lot of fruitflies in the room. I missed the contact with the reception, and the 5-star personal service. The location is super, and everything is in walking distance. I see the hotel as a good 4-star hotel with reasonable prices. We paid 153 a night without breakfast, so I think that price and quality fit together. My wife and me enjoyed the stay, allthough maybe the jacuzzi should be opened untill midnight.

Reviews.Title: “2 star mistaken for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: 88tm
Reviews.Content: Room: no practical Design, small sink water splashes everywhere, Toilette in close proximity to the bed, tv from the ceiling in the middle of the room so you easily bump your head into it and disturbing LED Night lights which cannot be switched off. Hoovering the floor during the breakfast. Staff without training and helpless. One positive side the Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “POOR FACILITIES”
Reviews.Author: LEGENDCapeTown
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds of hotels to chose from in Barcelona and I am afraid this one will not feature as one of my choices in the future . It is listed as 5 star and this is reflected in the price. Unfortunately, from the minute you walk into the hotel, it is a dissappointment. The lobby is dark and dinghy, the counters are dirty and the carpets in the passages are worn. The open plan room is dominated by a huge bath whose tap came off in my hand when I tried to use it. The shelf space in the bathroom are is tiny, the ammenties are cheap and inadequate, the breakfast was mediocre..the fresh fruit was abysmal quality..the only saving grace was the excellent service from the staff and the prime location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: j0nanana
Reviews.Content: quirky in design but absolutely perfect for a short city break. interesting way to incorporate the shower/toilet to bathroom - recommended for couples who are comfortable with all habits! bed was nice and big, comfy complete with fluffy pillows. roof-top jacuzzi was ideal way to start the day. neatly tucked away on one of the main streets and accessed by lift; location was fantastic (if we had bothered to look at signs on exiting the metro on arrival).

Reviews.Title: “read my professional review”
Reviews.Author: mo3eeeen
Reviews.Content: THE staff was very helpful and friendly ,especially mr Felipe Eddi , ill recomend this hotel for any barcelona visitor who would like to have a nice vacation in a comfortable nice designed hotel . there is some thing about this hotel ,Although i was living in a room that facing the street i didnt her any noise from outside the sound prof window was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not comparable with other 5-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: BirdieN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the last stretch of our holiday after having stayed at other 5-star hotels in Spain and this hotel isn't really the 5-star hotel standard. There was a mix-up with our rooms and we got a smoking room for our first night which ended up giving us severe hayfever and colds - and ruining our stay. Luckily we were able to switch rooms eventually, although a bit late. The breakfast spread at the hotel was good but not great. I would recommend this hotel if you were aiming for great central location and 4-stars or less hotel. Also be aware that the bathrooms arent another room but rather flowing from the bedroom - so make alternate plans if you are sharing with a stranger whose bathroom (toilet and shower/bath) habits you don't want to share.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNewitt
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel so much I had to write a review. The staff are amazing and so helpful they made our stay so enjoyable The hotel is great, the deco is a bit crazy but it's clean and fun and makes a change from your normal hotel. It's extremely clean and tidy. The breakfast is great you get a good selection, and it's a buffet so you can try different things. I recommend this hotel and will tell all my friends to go. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: hazzytomato
Reviews.Content: it was our first time to barcelona, and we're all very satisfied with the service/environment of this hotel. The staffs are very helpful and nice, they all speak fluent English. what's more,...the hotel location is brilliant, it's actually located on the main street, just few minutes walk to all the international labels/boutiques/restaurants. and the room rate is very reasonable. oh they provide free wifi too!

Reviews.Title: “Would I do this again?”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: I have angst writing this -- should I tell you to stay here or not? Let me get the positives out of the way. The hotel is ideally located in the center of things. The property is all quite modern and the staff is professional & accommodating. We stayed 5 nights in 2 different rooms (our choice). Bedding is comfortable and plenty of lighting in the large rooms. Rooms facing the back courtyard are dead quiet to the extent you can sleep with window open. Some rooms are quite large (floor 1-3), floor 4 rooms take interior space and give you instead a balcony that is quite large (perfect for a cup of coffee). Styling is quite modern. Internet is wireless and free. Small business center with printer. Now for the negatives. The bathroom is open to the room. I don't care how well you know someone, there is a desire for privacy. The dual sinks are stylish but functionally useless, there is no where to put your toiletries. The small size means you splash water everywhere. The room has some unique LED lighting and we could never fully turn it off (I ended up pulling the lightbulbs out). Finally, one Sunday morning, the maids made a huge racket starting at 8.30 in the morning. After a while it became obvious - they wanted the guests up and out.. This is not what you'd expect from this class of hotel. Would I tell you not to stay here? No. Would I tell you to see if there is something else in the neighborhood perhaps as an alternative. Yes. Mgmt suggestions: (1) Put a higher stand in bath area for toiletries (2) Figure out how to kill those LED lights at night or change to normal bulbs).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Leeddtravellor
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights in this hotel to celebrate his birthday. When we checked in we were given a small room with a bathroom and a shower room, when I'd requested a bath. We were moved to room 212 which was perfect, the biggest bed I'd ever seen and a bath in the room. I'd mentioned on checkin that it was my boyfriends birthday, the very helpful chap on reception said to remind him tomorrow (Saturday) and he'd give us a complimentary drink, which I did. They delivered to our room a complimentary bottle of Cava on ice with a plate of strawberries and chocolate - lovely touch. The location was perfect for exploring the city and the staff couldn't be more helpfull and give tips on where to eat, drink etc. Great weekend and great hotel, would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but too much psycodelic”
Reviews.Author: marcelosternick
Reviews.Content: Surely the best of this hotel is its location. The breakfast is good and the staff are very kind. The rooms are comfortable, but it seems like everything, a psychedelic dream of an architect, which gives little practicality. The reception on the first floor. This is another problem. We had trouble when we arrived with the luggage. On arrival, we wanted to eat something around 11 o'clock at night. The bar was open but had nothing to eat. Suggested that we look for a nearby restaurant. I found this a service failure. Another problem was the delay in arranging the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best 4-star on our Trip”
Reviews.Author: mshukh31
Reviews.Content: Location was superb, though not quite the W Hotel on the barcelonetta. The service during our whole stay was excellent and when we accidentally walked in on our room being cleaned, we were shocked at how thoroughly the rooms were cleaned. Very nice hotel, very modern / contemporary decor, great for couples. I don't think it is a good option for families or anyone over the age of 40, however. Great patio upstairs with tanning beds and a jacuzzi. Our only complaint is that the hot tub was lukewarm and did not fully work the second time we tried it out.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: fionnualaoregan
Reviews.Content: Never again! Appaling service, no room reserved, despite having written confirmation and had checked our accomadation the previous week when we had been shown our room. Extremly rude reception, very unprofessional behaviour to say the very least. Rooms were average while very dark and noisy. Breakfeast dreadful. The hotels best feature was its location and its worst feature its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Security is poor and the room is completely not functional”
Reviews.Author: EFehr
Reviews.Content: Great location, few minutes from La Rambla street. Security is poor and the room is completely not functional. I totally agreed with user "liltravels" comments dated June 7 2010 about security and room functionality. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad security and horrible room set up”
Reviews.Author: liltravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location across the street from the Mandarin Oriental. The worst part is the security. You enter from street level (no lobby) w/ your key card and then take the elevator straight to your floor of rooms. You never have to pass the lobby/reception. I entered the hotel as others were leaving a few times. The room is completely not functional. The rooms are large and we had a balcony which was nice. Our 16 mo son loved walking around the room. The sinks are two tall cylinders with absolutely not one inch of counter space. You have to leave your soap in the sink after you use it and Ladies, good luck putting on make up!! The glass doors on the shower and toilet leave you no modestly whatsoever and the same goes for getting in and out of the shower. The floors are very slippery when wet. It's just a disaster. They also only give you two towels. Period. No washcloths and forget a box of tissues. You pay so much money for the room and it feels the same as my cramped NYC apartment. Yuck. Also there were bugs all over the bathroom and our phone wouldnt accept calls from abroad to be transferred.

Reviews.Title: “Strange experience...”
Reviews.Author: Roy18101977
Reviews.Content: I went with my new girlfriend for 5 nights. Great location, with good restaurants and shops around the hotel. I didn't like the bathroom and shower with the glass doors. The doors didn't close properly so you could hear and see the person inside. No place to put your cloths next to the shower and the room is always getting wet because the of the glass doors. No cabinet next to the sink to put your tooth brush or shaving cream eather. On the other hand, I wasn't bothered by the noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but not practical.”
Reviews.Author: LuxeryHoliday
Reviews.Content: Good convenient location for seeing everything that Barcelona has to offer. Overall the hotel is very modern but not very practical or comfortable, a lot of noise at night which was annoying, could hear doors opening and closing and people walking in corridor. Strange bathroom with glass door! Food in morning could have a better selection. Staff had good restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not good”
Reviews.Author: twentysixfive
Reviews.Content: It is a modern hotel in a great location with really funky furniture most of which isn't actually comfortable to sit on though. The hotel looks great and the staff were very friendly and helpful but it reminded me of a warehouse. It is on a main street but you can't hear anything during the night from outside all you can hear is other guests, doors opening and closing, the elevator etc... everything echoes around the corridors, very annoying. The bed was huge and very comfortable but I didn't like the bathroom at all, all open plan and nothing but a glass door between the toilet and the bed. The door did not close properly so you could hear and see everything. I wouldn't consider this a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: frektman
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Modern and surprising design. Intimate dining room. FREE internet access and FREE office service! Located in the center of Barcelona, close to everything and everywhere. We get full value for money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel perfection location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Tinarci
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only two years old done very contempory fantastic location price is great too we had two nights b+b what a choice of food unreal and champagne and strawberrys one night in the package for €380 well worth

Reviews.Title: “Cool Modern Hotel Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: cammelview
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the BCN Design. The service was wonderful! The staff was very nice and helpful throughout the trip. The rooms were very clean and wonderfully designed. The pictures on their website are true to what the hotel looks like! The hotel has a restaurant, bar, FREE wifi, fitness center and jacuzzi on the rooftop. Room service and mini bar prices were extremely reasonable. We were there for our honeymoon. If you are used to having privacy in the bathroom, this hotel may not be for you as the bathroom in incorporated into the rest of the room. The bathtub is in the middle of the room, the shower & bathroom doors are frosted windows that can be seen from any part of the room. I didn't mind it at all. The design of the room was awesome and modern. It's located right on Passieg de Gracia, a 2 min walk to Plaza Catalunya and 2 min walk to Guadi's famous buildings. You can't beat the location! The Metro is across the street. The train station is a bout a block away, within walking distance with a large suitcase =). I would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay at a centrally located chic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As close to Gaudi as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: stegLeeds
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great positive surprise, as reading other reviews I didn't know what to expect. It was in the most amazing location, and the red entrance was fancy and promising :) The hotel staff was very helpful and gave great tips on how to get around and even what areas to avoid at night! The room was nice, although some of the designer's decisions might be quastionable. However, the bed was amazing, probably one of the best hotel beds i have ever experienced! The shower had a slightly weird smell, but that did not keep us from spending way too ling time in it due to an amazing experience - the shower was truly great! The location of the hotel was amazing, definately something to recommend to people who want to be at the most trendy spot in Barcelona. Great names like Chanel, Luis Vuitton and Armani were just next to the amazing buildings of Gaudi. A must-see even for those who have little inerest in architecture. And for those that like sightseeing by the bus - the City Sightseeing bus stops right outside the hotel. All in all, a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Gem in the heart of shopping, dining and with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sandraxms
Reviews.Content: Would have never stayed at the Eurostars BCN Design had it not been recommended to me, and now I am so happy I did - especially after seeing other 5 star hotels in Barcelona. What a gem: very modern, very funky, truly Barcelona. Spacious rooms with glorious bathrooms, some have the tub right there in the middle of the action (so great for couples). The location on the Passeig is amazing, yet the hotel is very tranquil. Staff was highly attentive, friendly and provided great advice. The rooftop terrace with jaccuzi is wonderful and so are the back terraces for reading, chilling etc. I definitely will stay there again if I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Most impractical design ever”
Reviews.Author: c66NewYork
Reviews.Content: I booked the superior room in sept. All I can say is that the designer of this hotel must be a straight man and had never used the rooms himself. Very simple, how can anyone use that tiny basin without wetting the floor/ their feet? The basin was the size of a dinner plate without anywhere to put the soap, any toiletries nor make up. The tiny side stand was 2 feet away on the floor. If you expect to put your contact lenses' case on that stand while putting on your contacts in front of the mirror, good luck! Bathtub was in the description and in the photos when I booked the room but in reality, there's none. It was a twin bedroom. Only 1 bed came with side table..... can this happen to a 5-star hotel? the only window in the bedroom was smaller than the size of a pillow. The open concept shower was the worst with the transparent door design. The shower was at the end of the twin beds, just below the TV. Although both me and my friend are girls, it still couldn't be more awkward. The room service staff didn't speak English. It was quite a struggle to try to get a Caesar salad. I think the whole weekend inside the hotel was a struggle but the location was good enough for me not to leave right away. However, after the weekend, I changed to the hotel Arts, in where I was treated as a true 5-star hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley01652
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the best city break we have ever had and would like to take this opportunity to thank the staff at the BCN design hotel for making it s special. This is a truly fantastic hotel in the most central location. The room was amazing and the hotel breakfast outstanding. We shall stay here again when we return to Barcelona. Thanks for the Champers! David Robinson and Kimberley Nutt

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: aroba007
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at around 10 am on a Monday morning, the not so friendly receptionist/checkin attendant told us they were fully booked and we would have to return after 3pm. After getting up at 4 am and leaving for a flight of 6 am, we were more than dismayed and in need of a shower, but what else were our options. After returning 5 hours later we got a room, but not the " Superior Double" we paid for [in advance btw] as they were over booked. We received a room with the view of a shaftway! and the bathroom was basically a part of the room that was separated by frosted glass. For here on in we had a negative view of this hotel. We complained and got another room, at least this room had a defined bathroom and sunlight. The next day we got the "superior double" *these words used to describe the room means NOTHING, so pls don't be fooled by their terms* it was bigger but still not what would be considered a 5 STAR hotel room. This room was larger and had a balcony over passeg de garcia but should not be considered a 5 star room. Other little annoyances, no printer for the "business center" how can i print my airline boarding passes No conditioner, no robes or slippers. ALso the gym (the term is used loosely( is subpar and the air conditioning did not work well so i used the elliptical in a warm 7 by 7 room!! don't be foole dby this so called 5 star hotel. OK so the few positives (hate to be so mean( the location is great as it's on the so called 5th avenue of barcelona and its a relatively short walk to las ramblas.. and the luggage boys were definately nice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Gorgonzola0673
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in this hotel. Check in was efficient and quick, once we got to the room we were happy to discover a nice, stylish and spacious room. It was clean and nicely decorated, and air condition worked really well. We had breakfast with the room service every morning at a reasonable price (15€ per person), minibar prices were cheap as well. The bed was king size and excellent, one little negative point was that the blankets had some stains, even though they were clean they were stained... There was a lovely jacuzzi on the roof with a nice view to Passeig de Gracia, nice after a day of walking and visiting, in the room there were no bathrobes or sleepers, they were on request, I consider that in a 5* it should be directly in the room. Location is perfect, in the most beautiful street of Barcelona and near everything! I've read all the other comments about the sinks, it is true that it would be excellent if they put an extra table near them to put your things on it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to young couples!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: kinginfl
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and very nice room. Our non-upgraded room included a balcony overlooking the Passeig de Gracia...really wonderful. The bathrooms though are very unusual with stained glass doors as the only separation between the toilet and the bedding area. As long as you are comfortable with your mate hearing all your unpleasant noises while viewing your lighted silhouette as you sit down...it really is a nice place. We loved Barcelona and will be back. We also will not hesitate to book a room at the BCN Design.

Reviews.Title: “great location, over designed and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: adamellis63
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for two nights, things didnt start well, as our prearranged transfer dropped us off at wrong hotel(not Eurostars fault). on arrival at hotel staff not over friendly or helpfull. did not have our reservation details, and not knowing what type of booking we had put us in first available room the room was right opposite the lifts and the noise was horrendous....hearsd everyones commings and goings the room.....although clean, was not what i would call 5 star or luxury accomodation, the overly designed bathroom was hopless...the sinks splashed everywhere, no shelf to put toiletries the list goes on .. complained about the glass toilet door ( which made so much noise opening that if went to loo at night woke the whole hotel up, and when asked for it to be looked at was told YES ( nobody ever came) this hotel could be great but the staff need a lesson in customer relations barcalona is great city......shame about this imposter of a luxury hotel

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have wished for better!”
Reviews.Author: game4alaff
Reviews.Content: Having arrived by the Renfe train into Barcelona city centre we had no trouble finding the BCN Design hotel. The hotel is situated on one of the main shopping streets, right in the centre. The location was perfect. We found all staff to be friendly, and very helpful at all times. Nothing was too much trouble. One grumble we had was that there were no ironing facilities. This meant that I couldnt wear a shirt for the evening, but luckily there were restaurants where a smart-ish t-shirt would be suitable. Also the walls are very thin, and its possible to hear everything going on next door. We were situated at the front of the hotel, and you couldnt hear a thing from outside. In-side was a different matter, although it didnt pose a problem for us, we did notice that you could hear what was going on next door. You have been warned! ;o) Having visited Las Ramblas we were glad we hadnt stayed in that particular area. Although nice to visit in the day, I wouldnt have felt comfortable there on a night. I had an amazing time in Bareclona. The Hotel was top notch, and I would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy”
Reviews.Author: funkysmile
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel with funky furniture (although not entirely practical - e.g. none of the basins have shelves next to them to put your stuff). Didn't really live up to its 5* rating I thought, and was a bit disappointed when one of my wife's belongings got stolen whilst we were out of the room. Bathtub in the room is something different - but you're only going to have CNN and Bloomberg to watch if you don't want to watch Spanish TV! Great location - all the cool shops are on the same road, and the tourist bus stops right outside. Recommend Tenorio and Citrus restaurants within 50m walk. Best thing about this hotel is the location for sure - but remember this is on a main road so you will hear police/ambulance sirens at night etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Anth1
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negatives out of the way first shall we.... There's no bath, there's insufficient space in the bathroom area to put your toiletries, no iron / ironing boards available and gym equipment that is never set up to work properly. But do you know what? Even taking all of those things into account, I still love this hotel and I've stayed in most hotels in Barcelona. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed, the beds are a fabulous size and are really comfortable. And the location just cannot be beaten - I defy anyone to find a better placed hotel in Barcelona. There's a small but lovely roof terrace with jacuzzi and also a lovely garden area. I think you'll either love or hate this place but if you like chic, modern hotels and you can put up with a few impracticalities, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “design over practicality”
Reviews.Author: Anniemw
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by this hotel and do not think it merits 5 stars There was no seperate bathroom indeed no bath, the loo was a glass cubicle with an ill fitting door and if one turned on the light during the night the whole room was illuminated. The shower cubicle also had an illfitting door and flooded every time, thus rendering the bath mat unusable and water pools all over the floor. The wash basins, without plugs, were so small with the tap above that using them was virtually impossible, especially for my husband shaving or rinsing ones teeth etc. Indeed frequently if the tap was turned on more than at 50% the water hit the bottom and spurted right out and over one. There was absolutely no space whatsoever for toiletries near the basins. One morning there was no water at all. Not even for the loo, this lasted for over an hour. The room was not made up until after 4.00pm, there was no turn down service or replacement of towels or soaking bathmat ready for the morning. The towels were thin and small and clearly rationed, there was no flannel, we were begrudgingly given 2 bathrobes - one in a tatty state when we requested them, they were not changed nor was the bedlinen. One bedside lamp was not working but loose off the wall. There was only one 'comfy' chair and very limited english based TV. (analogue only) The general hotel areas were very poor with no comfy lounge etc. service was difficcult to obtain. Receptions understanding of english was limited and I suspect some had limited spanish too. The only really good thing about this hotel was its location which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first few nights of our honeymoon and loved it. We were a bit skeptical after the bad reviews on TA but it was one of the best places we stayed on our 6 week honeymoon. It was also one of the best value for money hotels. It cost about 25 Euro to get a taxi from the airport to the hotel. Next time we'd probably just jump on the train/bus that goes direct to Catalanya Square and get a taxi from there. The reception staff were really friendly. We were greeted with champagne at check-in as it was our honeymoon which I thought was a nice touch. The room was really spacious and ultra-trendy which is what we like. The bed was really comfortable and we had a great view out onto one of the most prestigious streets of Barcelona. The bath was awesome too and a nice place to relax after a days sightseeing in the cold. The free wifi is an added plus. The hotel's location is great. We hardly used the metro system as everything was within walking distance. We walked from the hotel to La Pedra, then to La Sangria Familia and the next day down Las Ramblas to the gothic quarter (about a 10-15 minute walk). There is a metro stop about 100m from the front door of the hotel if you want to use it. Make sure you eat at Cafe Cervecerria (see TA reviews) as this was the highlight of our trip. We would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there next time we visit Barcelona.
